newsitem.title: USA: New US corporate debt issues tighten, more on way.
newsitem.headline: New US corporate debt issues tighten, more on way.

text.p: More corporate bond issues are on the way following Wednesday's successful pricing of three new deals now trading at tighter spreads, syndicate sources said.
Polaroid Corp is expected to issue a $250 million Baa3/BBB rated two-part debt offering this week via Lehman Brothers.
The offering is expected to consist of $100 million in five-year debt and $150 in ten-year debt, sources added.
Among other issuers expected to tap the market are US West Capital Funding Inc, a unit of U S West Inc.
The $2.0 billion, four-part A2/BBB-plus rated debt offering consists of five, 10, 30 and 40-year maturities and is expected to be underwritten by Merrill Lynch.
Among Wednesday's isuers were Merrill Lynch and Co's 7.25 percent 10-year deal which tightened when freed up to trade, dealers said.
"The issue's a touch tighter in the secondary market," said one high-grade syndicate source. "It's trading at a spread of 57 bid after pricing yesterday at 59 basis points over (Treasuries)."
Merrill's $500 million Aa3/AA-minus rated 10-year debt offering, met with strong investor demand, was uppped in size from an initial $350 million.
Lehman Brothers issued $300 million in Baa1/A rated 10-year notes to yield 92 basis points over Treasuries. The deal was also upped in size from an initial $200 million to meet investor demand.
Dealers said Lehman's deal had not been freed up to trade as yet.
Also, Tosco Corp issued a successful three-part debt offering consisting of the following tranches:
-$200 million in 10-year debt to yield 72 basis points,
-$300 million in 30-year paper to yield 94 basis points
-$100 million in 50-year bonds to yield 103 basis points over Treasuries.
On Thursday, Tosco's 10-year paper tightened to 71 basis points, the 30-year paper tightened to 89 basis points and the 50-year bonds tightened to 101 basis points, when freed to trade, dealers said.
The deal was rated Baa2/BBB-minus and was underwritten by Morgan Stanley & Co.

Meanwhile, Merrill Lynch is expected to underwrite a $300 million two-part deal for Reliance Industries, sources said. The deal is expected to consist of $200 million in 30-year bonds with a put option in the tenth year, and $100 million of noncallable 100-year bonds.
Looking ahead, Baxter International may also tap the market this week or next, syndicate sources said.

Baxter's deal is expected to consist of a $450 million in A3/A rated two-part debt via Goldman Sachs & Co. The first tranche is expected to consist of $250 million in 10-year debt and $200 million in 30-year debt, sources said.
Among trust preferred deals Aon Corp is expected to bring its $700 million 30-year trust preferred issue via Morgan Stanley & Co as early as this week, sources said.
BankAmerica Corp is also expected to tap the market with $450 million in A1/A-minus rated trust preferred securities due 2026.
Orion Capital Corp is expected to issue $125 million in 40-year trust preferred securities, syndicate sources said.
Markel Corp is also rumored to be currently structuring a trust preferred deal of their own, sources said.
TCI Communications Inc is preparing a $500 million trust preferred securities deal for one day next week via Lehman Brothers, sources said.

Turning to the high-yield sector, Tenet HealthCare is getting set to bring a two-part debt offering consisting of $800 million in notes due 2007 and $500 million in notes due 2007, market sources said.
The deal is expected to be underwritten by Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette Securities.

Also on the calendar is a $150 million deal for American Radio Systems Corp, a $110 million deal for CFP Holdings, $100 million debt offering for Chancellor Radio Braodcasting and $100 million deal for Derlan Manufacturing, dealers said.
Currently, the benchmark 30-year U.S. Treasuey bond is up 24/32 at 96-13/32 to yield 6.78 percent.
((--Nancy Leinfuss, 212-859-1675))
